newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent untraded, indicated lower after API.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent untraded, indicated lower after API.

text.p: June Brent crude futures prices were untraded at midday in Asia, but were indicated lower after API data revealed a higher-than expected rise in U.S. stocks.
June Brent on SIMEX was quoted at $19.25/$19.45 per barrel after London fell 10 cents overnight to settle at $19.62.
July was quoted at $19.15/19.45 compared with London's close at $19.46.
However, NYMEX crude futures were 29 cents down from New York at $21.08 after the American Petroleum Institute (API) data.

After the close of New York trading, API said crude stocks rose in the U.S. last week 6.94 million barrels when a 750,000-barrel build had been expected. Gasoline stocks surged 6.5 million, against expectations of 1.0 million.
"It's obviously API driven on ACCESS but the price fall is quite mild when you consider we have come up a long way," one broker said. June had gained almost $1 since last week.
Despite the NYMEX sell off, June was being supported at $21.00 -- the current intraday low -- with bids backed by healthy volumes.
